context_of_use: This use case allows power users to execute bulk actions to improve their efficiency in handling data.
stakeholders_and_interests: power user: Improve efficiency in data handling.
system: Ensure successful execution of bulk operations.
description: Enable power users to execute bulk actions (e.g., mass updates or imports) to improve efficiency.
triggering_event: Power user initiates a request to perform bulk operations.
preconditions: Power user has access to bulk operation features.
postconditions: System reflects the changes made by the bulk operations.
assumptions: The power user has the necessary permissions to perform bulk operations.
The system is capable of handling bulk operations without errors.
requirements_met: The system shall allow power users to perform bulk operations.
The system shall ensure that bulk operations are executed efficiently.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of bulk operations supported by the system.
main_flow: 1. Power user initiates a request to perform bulk operations → System displays available bulk operation options.
2. Power user selects the desired bulk operation → System prompts for necessary data inputs.
3. Power user provides the required data → System processes the bulk operation.
4. System confirms the successful execution of the bulk operation → Power user receives confirmation message.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If no bulk operation options are available, then the system displays a message indicating that no operations can be performed.
AF-2 (from Step 2): If the power user cancels the operation, then the system returns to the main menu without executing any bulk operations.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If the provided data is invalid, then the system displays an error message and prompts the power user to correct the data.
information_for_steps: 2. Data inputs for the selected operation
